content:
• Friday, December 8, 2017

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: UTSI +7.6%. FATE +6.5%. OSTK +3.8%. IMDZ +3.8%. VSTM +3.9%.
    • Top losers: CYTK -5.0%. DERM -4.6%. SGRY -2.6%. VSAR-OLD -2.2%. QURE -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 6 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: URA +9.7%. EPI +2.2%. XLF +1.5%. XLI +1.5%. UUP +1.1%.
    • Top losers: GAZ -10.7%. UNG -9.3%. VXX -7.6%. REMX -5.3%. GDXJ -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • AKTX

    Akari's Coversin successful in mid-stage PNH study

    • A Phase 2 clinical trial, COBALT, assessing Akari Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:AKTX) lead candidate Coversin in patients with paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) met the primary endpoint of a statistically significant reduction in LDH (lactate dehydrogenase) to within 1.8x the upper limit of normal (ULN) by day 28 (a reduction to within 2x of ULN within 28 days is considered successful).
    • The last three patients enrolled, treated with the higher dose of 45 mg, experienced a drop in LDH to 1.5x the ULN at day 14 and below 1.5x the ULN at day 28 and day 60. Subjects receiving the 30 mg dose showed a median LDH value of 2.2x the ULN at day 28 and 1.7x the ULN at day 60.
    • Half (n=3/6) of the transfusion-dependent patients at study entry did not a require transfusion while on Coversin therapy during COBALT or the long-term safety study.
    • Two Phase 3 studies evaluating the 45 mg/day dose should commence next quarter. CAPSTONE will assess Coversin in treatment-naive PNH patients and ASSET will include patients that will switch from Alexion Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:ALXN) Soliris (eculizumab).
    • Coversin is a second-generation complement inhibitor.
    • Management will host an investor and analyst event on Sunday, December 10 at 8:00 pm ET.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours on light volume.
    • PNH-related tickers: RARX ACHN APLS OTCQX:RHHBY FBIO EPRS ALNY
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 15 Comments
  • MDSO

    Deutsche Bank initiates Medidata

    • Deutsche Bank initiates Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) with a Buy rating and $78 price target.
    • The firm calls Medidata well positioned to benefit from positive long-term secular trends as the only company with an end-to-end clinical cloud platform. 
    • Deutsche Bank sees the current valuation as reasonable compared to software peers.
    • Medidata shares are up 1.3%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM

    Cross Research upgrades TE Connectivity

    • Cross Research upgrades TE Connectivity (NYSE:TEL) from Hold to Buy.
    • Latest analyst recommendations (via FT): 5 Buy, 4 Outperform, 3 Hold, and 1 Underperform. 
    • Median price target: $100.50. 
    • TE Connectivity shares are up 0.75%.     
    • Previously: TE Connectivity announces $1.5B increase to its share repurchase program (Dec. 8)

    Vertical Research upgrades Science Applications

    • Vertical Research upgrades Science Applications (NYSE:SAIC) from Hold to Buy and raises the price target from $75 to $83.
    • Analyst Krishna Sinha cites the Q3 revenue and margin beats with solid bookings and bid pipeline strength.  
    • Science Applications shares are up 6.9%.

  • GIGM

    GigaMedia CEO purchases additional shares

    • GigaMedia (NASDAQ:GIGM) announces CEO Cheng-Ming Huang purchased 55,070 shares.
    • Average share price was $2.9375. 
    • The CEO now holds 292,678 shares.   
    • GigaMedia shares are up 2.8%.

  • MSFT

    Evercore raises Microsoft price target, sees $1T valuation by FY21

    • Evercore ISI analysts think Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) can hit a $1T market cap by 2020.
    • The analysts cite Microsoft 365 products as a growth driver and expect the business to generate $26.86B in sales in FY21, which starts in the second half of 2020.
    • Over $5B of that revenue will come from Office 365’s consumer business.
    • The analysts also expect Microsoft’s Azure cloud business to continue growing to FY21 sales of $22.19B. 
    • Price target raises from $93 to $106. 
    • Microsoft shares are up 2%.  
    • Previously: EU filing brief in Supreme Court case involving Microsoft data (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 42 Comments

    | 12:50 PM
  • AAPL

    Digitimes: Apple suppliers shipments down on month, expect weak Dec.

    • Digitimes sources report that Largan wasn’t the only Apple (AAPL +0.4%) supplier that had weak shipments in November with a further drop expected this month.
    • Catcher technology, a chassis maker, had revenue drop 10.4% on the month in November. 
    • General Interface Solutions, which provides touch panels, had a 15.53% decline after expecting sales to grow into next year. 
    • The sources say Apple lowered its iPhone X component orders 30% below forecast in November and expect the same sequential percentage drop in Q1 due to seasonality and fewer working days in the quarter. But Q1 shipments could grow on the year. 
    • Apple suppliers that can move with news: Skyworks (SWKS -0.1%), Cirrus Logic (CRUS +0.7%), Qorvo (QRVO -0.4%), and Broadcom (AVGO -0.3%).  
    • Previously: Apple suppliers recover after Broadcom sales comments (Dec. 7)
    • Previously: Apple suppliers drop after Largan warns of lower Dec. revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 35 Comments
  • CELG

    Celgene up 3% ahead of ASH presentations

    • Celgene (CELG +2.7%) is steadily climbing back from its late October selloff after its mongersen flop in Crohn's and Q3 revenue miss.
    • There is a long list of abstracts related the company's and collaboration partners Juno Therapeutics (JUNO +1.8%) and bluebird bio's (BLUE +3.2%) pipeline candidates that will be presented during the Annual Meeting of the American Society of Hematology in Atlanta, December 9 - 12.
    • Jefferies' Michael Yee is bullish on the company (BUY/$125) citing a turnaround play thesis led by bullish prospects for CAR-T therapies.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 9 Comments
  • AMGN

    Coherus to prevail in Amgen patent infringement suit; shares up 4%

    • A U.S. Magistrate Judge has recommended that the U.S. District Court in Delaware dismiss plaintiff Amgen's (AMGN +1%) complaint against Coherus Biosciences (CHRS +3.6%) for alleged infringement on U.S. Patent No. 8,273,707.
    • Amgen filed the complaint in May after Coherus submitted a marketing application seeking approval for a biosimilar of Neulasta (pegfilgrastim).
    • Coherus expects a publicly available version of the Magistrate's report in ~two weeks.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Coherus' marketing application for Neulasta biosimilar; shares down 34% premarket (June 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • DPW

    Digital Power down 16.5% after capital raise

    • Halted from trade all session, Digital Power (NYSEMKT:DPW) just resumed, down 16.5%.
    • The company minutes ago released details on a number of transactions.
    • DPW prior to the open on Thursday pushed out a press release jacking 2018 revenue guidance by 50%. Caveat emptor.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 13 Comments
  • TRVG

    Deutsche Bank upgrades Trivago

    • Deutsche Bank raises its Trivago (NASDAQ:TRVG) rating from Hold to Buy with a $10 price target.

  • IR

    Ingersoll-Rand upgraded to Buy at Goldman

    • Ingersoll-Rand (IR +1%) is higher after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $100 price target, as analyst Joseph Ritchie calls the stock is his favorite value idea for 2018.
    • Ritchie is positive on the Americas multi-Industry space for 2018 due to capital expenditure growth and tax reform, which the firm believes could drive investment and improve margins.
    • Goldman also initiates Kratos Defense (KTOS -4.2%) with a Neutral rating, saying a mixed operating track record along with valuation offset the company's top-line potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • DNLI

    Denali Therapeutics strong out of the blocks, up 14%

    • Denali Therapeutics (NASDAQ:DNLI) is up 14% on turnover of 2M shares in its U.S. debut. Shares are currently changing hands at ~$20.50 versus the $18 offer price.
    • Previously: Denali upsizes IPO to $250M (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • SCG

    Scana rises on takeover rumors, with NextEra a potential suitor

    • Scana (SCG +2.2%) is moving higher on rumors that the company is about to be sold, possibly to NextEra Energy (NEE -0.1%), the Florida-based company that is said to be submitting a serious offer to buy South Carolina's state-run energy utility Santee Cooper; meanwhile, SCG’s natural gas assets reportedly would be sold to Dominion Energy (D -0.3%).
    • The moves could make sense: Dominion is "expanding its gas footprint,” NEE has “a voracious appetite for electric utility acquisition,” and SCG is seeking survival after its failed nuclear project in the state, an unnamed analyst tells Fitsnews.com.
    • Reports last week said South Carolina's governor was seeking to sell Santee Cooper to potentially interested buyers including NEE, D, Duke Energy or Southern Co.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 26 Comments
  • RDUS

    Radius Health's elacestrant shows positive effect in early-stage breast cancer study; shares ahead 15%

    • Radius Health (RDUS +15%) is up on 50% higher volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing elacestrant (RAD1901) in estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer. The data were presented at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • In 22 patients with measurable disease, the response rate was 27% (n=6/22), all partial responders.
    • On the safety front, elacestrant was well-tolerated with most adverse events being low-grade nausea, vomiting and indigestion.
    • The company plans to launch a Phase 2 study in ER+/HER2- breast cancer next quarter. It will no longer evaluate it for vasomotor symptoms.
    • Elacestrant is an orally available estrogen receptor degrader (down-regulator).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 4 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    Teva may cut as many as 10K jobs; shares up 6%

    • Aimed at shoring up its operations, Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA +5.6%) may eliminate as many as 10K positions Bloomberg reports.
    • Previously: "Significant action" needed to steady company - Teva (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 50 Comments
  • TOSBF

    NAND and DRAM prices fall on the week (update)

    • NAND prices fell 1.47% in the past week. The six-week average is down 0.55%.
    • PC DRAM prices fell 1.14% in the week. The six-week average is up 1.03%.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Top NAND companies with Q3 market share: Samsung (OTCPK:TOSBF, OTCPK:TOSYY), 37.2%; Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF, OTCPK:TOSYY), 17.5%; SanDisk/Western Digital (NYSE:WDC), 17.5%; and Micron (NASDAQ:MU), 12.9%.
    • Top DRAM companies with Q3 market shares: Samsung, 45.8%; SK Hynix, 28.7%; Micron, 21%.
    • Micron shares are up 2.2% premarket.
    • Western Digital shares are up 1.6%.
    • Update: In contrast to Bloomberg's data, DRAMeXchange has the average DRAM price up 1 cent and the NAND price down 2 cents.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 97 Comments
  • PRTY

    Party City -10% after large secondary offering disclosed

    • Shares of Party City (NYSE:PRTY) are down 9.88% after the company's secondary offering on the behalf of selling shareholders caught investors by surprise.
    • Party City is buying back 2.5M shares out of the 10M being dumped. The company says it will use cash on hand and credit facility borrowings to make the purchases.
    • Previously: Party City discloses secondary offering (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • SYY

    Wells Fargo confident on Sysco

    • Wells Fargo lifts its price target on Sysco (NYSE:SYY) following what it calls a "bullish analyst meeting" this week.
    • The food distributor set guidance on incremental EBIT to $650M-$700M through FY20 to top the prior Wells forecast.
    • WF rates Sysco at Outperform and assigns a price target of $64. Shares of Sysco are up 7.5% since the analyst meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • STDY

    SteadyMed up 34% premarket on pathway for resubmission of Trevyent

    • Thinly traded nano cap SteadyMed (NASDAQ:STDY) is up 34% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that the FDA will not require any additional clinical trials to support its NDA resubmission for Trevyent for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH).
    • Per agency feedback, the company will need to repeat in vitro design verification testing on the final product, supported by pharmacokinetic modeling and process validation.
    • The application will be made under the 505(b)(2) pathway which allows the inclusion of data generated by others.
    • Previously: FDA rejects SteayMed's marketing application for lead candidate Trevyent for PAH; shares down 28% premarket (Aug. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • AQMS

    Aqua Metals prices 7.15M-share offering at $2.10

    • Aqua Metals (NASDAQ:AQMS) -19% premarket after pricing a public offering of 7.15M common shares at $2.10 each; the underwriter gets an option to purchase up to an additional ~1M shares.
    • AQMS plans to use the net proceeds for working capital, which could include capex related to the expansion of production activities at its initial AquaRefining facility in Nevada, and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 2 Comments

    Oppenheimer upgrades Synaptics

    Wedbush initiates GoDaddy

    • Wedbush initiates GoDaddy (NYSE:GDDY) with a Neutral rating and $52 price target.
    • GoDaddy shares are up 4.9% premarket. 
    • Previously: GoDaddy prices common stock offering (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • CIEN

    Piper Jaffray downgrades Ciena

    • Piper Jaffray downgrades Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) from Overweight to Neutral and lowers the price target from $29 to $22.
    • Analyst Troy Jensen sees challenges in the company’s growth targets due to competitive pressure. 
    • Ciena shares are down 0.58% premarket.  
    • Previously: Ciena +5.8% after mixed Q4 results, share repurchase program (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • SLNO

    Soleno up 16% premarket on move away from Capnia

    • Soleno Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SLNO) and wholly owned subsidiary Capnia ink a joint venture agreement with Hong Kong-based OptAsia Healthcare Limited (OAHL) to develop and commercialize Capnia's Sensalyze technology, including the CoSense End-Tidal Carbon Monoxide monitor.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, OAHL will make up to a $2.2M equity investment in Capnia (NASDAQ:CAPN) which means that it will no longer be a wholly-owned subsidiary of Soleno. Henceforward, OAHL will fund Capnia's operations. OAHL also has the option of acquiring the rest of Capnia at a value based on revenue.
    • Soleno says the deal will enable it to sharpen its focus on developing rare disease therapeutics. Lead candidate is once-daily tablet diazoxide choline for Prader-Willi syndrome.
    • SLNO is up 16% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 2 Comments

  • Treasury yields move higher after jobs beat

    • The U.S. added 228K jobs in November, besting estimates by 28K. October's 261Kk gain was revised down to 244K, and September's 18K up to 38K. We'll call revisions a wash.
    • The unemployment rate was flat at 4.1%, as was the labor force participation rate at 62.7%. The broader U-6 unemployment rose ticked up to 8% in November.
    • The average workweek edged higher to 34.5 hours. Average hourly earnings rose a nickel to $26.55; on a year-over-year basis, they're up 2.5%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield has moved up a couple of basis points since the report hit, now at 2.39%. TLT -0.4%, TBT +0.8%.
    • Gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) remains down a hair, and the dollar (NYSEARCA:UUP) modestly higher.
    • Stock index futures also remain modestly higher, led by the Nasdaq 100's 0.5% advance.
    • Previously: 228K jobs added in November; UE rate stable at 4.1% (Dec. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 15 Comments
  • X

    Metals stocks move up as China’s commodity demand picks up

    • Metals stocks are mostly higher after China reported exports surged 12.3% in November from a year ago, more than double expectations, and imports climbed 17.7%; X +1.5%, VALE +1.3%, BHP +1.2%, CLF +0.9%, FCX +0.8%, RIO flat in premarket trade.
    • China’s demand for commodities jumped, as the world’s largest consumer of raw materials saw higher imports of copper, crude oil and iron ore; shipments of copper soared 42%, iron ore jumped 19%, and imports of crude oil hit 9.04M bbl/day, their second highest recorded level ever.
    • Traders say the import data should help support commodity prices, which have been hit by concerns about slowing economic growth in China.
    • Jefferies analysts say sharp declines in Chinese finished steel exports show improved supply-side discipline while low inventories and strong prices and margins further highlight market tightness; the firm says ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) is its sector favorite.
    • ETFs: JJC, DBB, JJN, CPER, JJU-OLD, BOM, BOS, NINI, JJM, CUPM, BDD, FOIL, RJZ, BDG-OLD, UBM, HEVY
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 19 Comments
  • GBTC

    More Bitcoin: Worrying about the whales; Coinbase becomes #1 app

    • Above the fold on Bloomberg this morning is what's apparently meant to be a cautionary tale about the Bitcoin Whales. According to the story, about 40% of the crypto is held by maybe 1K users.
    • What if they collude, or what if they all decide to sell at once, worries the author. Sounds pretty much any other asset class. A wise trader (Paul Tudor Jones?) once said, when you own that much of the market, you are the market.
    • Others looking for bell-ringing news will find it in Coinbase. The crypto exchange's app has moved from barely visible in the rankings to the most-downloaded iPhone app in the country. Yesterday's frenzied action in Bitcoin crashed the Coinbase site.
    • Bitcoin continues to head lower, now down 13.5% to $14,580.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM | 79 Comments
  • CDXC

    Chromadex up 8% premarket on promising research on nicotinamide riboside

    • Thinly traded micro cap Chromadex (NASDAQ:CDXC) is up 8% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of encouraging research data on vitamin nicotinamide riboside (NR) in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease (AD). The results were just published in the journal Nature.
    • The data showed AD mice treated with NR showed lower levels of amyloid deposits, improved mitochondrial energy production and improved memory.
    • NR was discovered by Chromadex Chief Scientific Advisor Dr. Charles Brenner and is being developed by the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • AOBC

    Firearms sector on watch after American Outdoor print, House vote

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC) is lower in early action after cutting its revenue and EPS forecast for the full year due to challenging market conditions.
    • The cut in guidance was the second of the year for AOBC and included a signal of sustained lower firearms demand from some retail channels.
    • The gun sector was boosted yesterday before American Outdoor spilled its numbers by the House of Representatives approval of a bill that loosens some concealed carry regulations along with tighter instant criminal background checks records.
    • AOBC -15.5% premarket, keep an eye on Sportsman's Warehouse (NASDAQ:SPWH), Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR) and Vista Outdoors (NYSE:VSTO).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 13 Comments
  • ERYP

    ERYTECH's lead product candidate flunks mid-stage AML study; shares off 28% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap ERYTECH Pharma (NASDAQ:ERYP) slumps 28% premarket in response to its announcement that its Phase 2b clinical trial evaluating lead candidate GRASPA (eryaspase) for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia (AML) failed to achieve the primary endpoint of overall survival.
    • ERYTECH will hold a conference call and webcast on December 11 at 10:00 am ET to discuss the data.
    • GRASPA is the enzyme L-asparaginase, a standard component of chemo for ALL, encapsulated inside donor-derived red blood cells. Its value proposition is a better tolerability profile versus non-encapsulated asparaginases.
    • Shares are down 28% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM | 3 Comments
  • CKPT

    Premarket analyst action - healthcare

    • Checkpoint Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CKPT) initiated with Buy rating and $11 (139% upside) price target by H.C. Wainwright.
    • Catalyst Biosciences (NASDAQ:CBIO) initiated with Buy rating and $19 (166% upside) price target by B. Riley FBR.
    • DENTSPLY SIRONA (NASDAQ:XRAY) initiated with Buy rating and $81 (25% upside) price target by Deutsche Bank.
    • Teladoc (NYSE:TDOC) initiated with Buy rating and $39 (16% upside) price target by Deutsche Bank.
    • Patterson Companies (NASDAQ:PDCO) initiated with Hold rating and $37 (5% upside) price target by Deutsche Bank.
    • Repligen (NASDAQ:RGEN) initiated with Buy rating and $45 (30% upside) price target by Citigroup.
    • Athenahealth (NASDAQ:ATHN) initiated with Hold rating by Deutsche Bank.
    • Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN) initiated with Hold rating by Deutsche Bank.
    • Medidata (NASDAQ:MDSO) initiated with Buy rating by Deutsche Bank.
    • Lipocine (NASDAQ:LPCN) resumed with Buy rating and $10 (190% upside) price target by H.C. Wainwright.
    • Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) upgraded to Strong Buy by Needham.
    • Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) upgraded to Overweight by Atlantic Equities.
    • Perrigo (NASDAQ:PRGO) upgraded to Buy by Argus Research.
    • La Jolla Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:LJPC) downgraded to Underweight by JPMorgan.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 AM | 7 Comments
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs announces merger termination fee

    • Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM) says it will pay a $11.5M termination fee if the merger with Silicon Labs (NASDAQ:SLAB) terminates under certain circumstances.
    • Silicon Labs announced its planned acquisition of Sigma aftermarket yesterday.
    • Sigma Designs shares are up 24.1% premarket.  
    • Previously: Silicon Labs to buy Sigma Designs for $7.05/share (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • LC

    LendingClub bull stays so after yesterday's disappointment

    • Guidance for Q4 of this year and all of next year was shy of hopes yesterday, sending LendingClub (NYSE:LC) tumbling 15.5%.
    • "We find it remarkable that a reduced outlook due in large part to short-term adjustments to the company's credit model," would spook investors so much, says BTIG's Mark Palmer, reiterating his Buy rating, but trimming the price target to $7 from $9 (still 100% upside from yesterday's close).
    • He notes banks - which fled LC's platform in wake the CEO resignation - have returned. Further, the company has diversified funding with successful loan securitizations, and approved more than 100M loan applications this year.
    • While LendingClub has tightened underwriting standards and thus reduced its near-term outlook, the future looks promising at a very cheap price, says Palmer.
    • Shares +1.7% premarket to $3.65.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 19 Comments
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies responds to Citron Research accusation

    • Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) responds to Citron Research’s Wednesday tweet calling the company a fraud.
    • Key quote: “The Company reaffirms its commitment to transparent and reliable shareholder communication, and its adherence to the highest standards of corporate governance. Himax cautions investors that Citron Research has never made any contacts with the Company and that the tweet did not contain any input from the Company. Himax categorically denies any and all allegations of fraud.” 
    • Himax shares are up 1.9% premarket.    
    • Previously: Himax -10.2% after Citron Research tweet (Dec. 6)

  • CBOE

    Bitcoin lower by 11% ahead of futures opening

    • Bitcoin futures will become available for trade at the CBOE on Sunday evening. After yesterday's wild ride which saw the crypto sky to nearly $20K (on some exchanges), it's lower by 11% this morning to just under $15K.
    • Alt coins - which had almost uniformly headed lower this week amid Bitcoin's surge - are mostly in the green. Ether is up 5% and Litecoin 3%.
    • Meanwhile, Coindesk is reporting that South Korean regulators have apparently banned futures contracts and other derivatives tied to Bitcoin.
    • "Please invest responsibly," writes the chief of Coinbase in a blog post this morning.
